content:
Diagnosis:		Locally advanced right upper lobe squamous cell carcinoma

Management:		Completed concurrent chemoradiotherapy March 2024
			Weekly cisplatin with radical radiotherapy 60Gy in 30 fractions

Histology:		Squamous cell carcinoma, PD-L1 60%
			Stage IIIA disease

Current situation:	Post-treatment review

[redacted name] attended follow-up clinic today. She has completed concurrent chemoradiotherapy 6 weeks ago with good tolerance. Her radiation pneumonitis has now resolved and she reports improved energy levels. Her initial dyspnoea has significantly improved. Performance status remains 1. Recent CT chest shows good partial response with >50% reduction in primary tumor size. Blood tests show stable renal function and normal FBC. The plan is to commence maintenance durvalumab immunotherapy next week as per protocol. We will arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after 3 cycles. Review in 4 weeks with blood tests.

cancer_timeline.value: Commenced concurrent chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin
CT chest shows >50% reduction in primary tumor size

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function and normal full blood count

status_updates.value: Locally advanced right upper lobe squamous cell carcinoma showing good response to concurrent chemoradiotherapy with resolving treatment-related pneumonitis
>50% reduction in primary tumor size on CT
Plan to commence maintenance durvalumab immunotherapy
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after 3 cycles of durvalumab
Review in 4 weeks with blood tests
